title: Classic French Onion Soup
notes: Onions cook low and slow for about 45 minutes to draw out their natural sweetness, creating deep, meaty flavors. Can substitute wine with extra beef stock if preferred.

ingredients.name: large yellow onions, peeled, halved and thinly sliced
ingredients.original: 6 large yellow onions (peeled, halved and thinly sliced - about 2½ pounds)

ingredients.name: garlic, minced
ingredients.original: 1 tablespoon minced garlic (or 4 cloves garlic, minced)

ingredients.name: all-purpose flour
ingredients.original: ¼ cup flour (plain or all purpose)

ingredients.name: dry white wine
ingredients.original: ½ cup dry white wine or red wine

base: Heat butter and olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat
Add sliced onions and cook slowly for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until onions are caramelized and deep golden brown
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 more minute until fragrant
Sprinkle flour over the onions and stir to coat evenly
Pour in wine and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot
Add beef stock, beef bouillon powder, thyme, and bay leaves
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-30 minutes
Remove bay leaves and thyme sprigs
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot with cheesy garlic bread or gruyere cheese toasts
